items.description: Upper Teme

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Teme, River Onny, River Corve

items.message:
River levels are high but steady at the Onibury river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible overnight today 25/12/21.  We believe there is a possibility of flooding for low lying land and roads adjacent the River Teme, River Onny and River Corve and their tributaries. Locations that may be affected include Bishops Castle, Church Stretton, Knighton and Ludlow. Predicted peaks:- Onibury 1.6m to 1.8m Sunday morning 26/12/21.
Further heavy rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours.  We expect river levels to remain high until 26/12/21.
We are closely monitoring the situation.  Our incident response staff are checking defences.  
Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  
This message will be updated  by 09:00 on 26/12/21, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Upper Avon River Swift and Clay Coton Brook
items.message:
River levels are forecast to rise at the Clay Coton river gauge as a result of expected rainfall over the next 24 hours. Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible tonight Friday 24/12/2021 into tomorrow Saturday 25/12/2021. Flooding is forecast to affect low-lying land and roads adjacent to River Avon between Stanford and Rugby, River Swift between Cosford and Rugby and Clay Coton Brook between Yelvertoft and Lilbourne
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are actively checking river levels and the weather forecast.
Please avoid using low lying footpaths and bridges near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  
This message will be updated tomorrow, 25/12/2021, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Leam and River Itchen
items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels have now fallen below the flood Alert risk threshold.  We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.  Further rainfall is forecast overnight.  
Our incident response staff are actively monitoring river levels and the weather forecast.  
Please avoid using low lying footpaths and bridges near local watercourses.

items.description: River Arrow and River Alne
items.message:
River levels are forecast to rise at the Little Alne river gauge as a result of expected rainfall over the next 24 hours. Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible tonight Friday 24/12/2021 into tomorrow Saturday 25/12/2021. Flooding is forecast to affect low-lying land and roads adjacent to the River Arrow between Studley and Salford Priors and the River Alne between Bird in Hand and Alcester on the River Alne including farmland and caravan parks.
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are actively checking river levels and the weather forecast.
Please avoid using low lying footpaths and bridges near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  
This message will be updated tomorrow, 25/12/2021, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Upper Nene
items.message: The risk of flooding in the Upper Nene area has now reduced and levels have fallen below levels of concern.  No further flooding to fields and roads is expected, however there may be standing water seen for several days. Further rainfall is forecast over the next few days and we will continue to monitor the situation.

items.description: North Sea coast at Bridlington
items.message: The flood alert for the North Sea coast at Bridlington has been issued. Overtopping waves and spray are expected as a result of strong onshore winds for the North Sea coast at Bridlington. Overtopping waves are expected on Saturday morning, 25/12/2021 between 10.30am and 11.15am particularly around Bridlington South Pier and Lifeboat Station. Overtopping waves are also expected on Saturday evening between 19:45 hours and 01:00am on Sunday 26/12/2021. Please be careful along beaches, coastal and estuary footpaths and roads in the area, as large waves and sea spray can be dangerous with debris. We will continue to monitor the forecast and levels closely. This message will be updated on Saturday morning, 25/12/2021, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Tove in Northamptonshire
items.message:
River levels are rising at the Cappenham river gauge as a result of recent rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible today, 25/12/21.  We expect flooding to affect River Tove from Towcester to Cosgrove, including Silverstone Brook   
Further rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours.  We expect river levels to continue rising. 
We are closely monitoring the situation.  
Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  
This message will be updated this evening, 25/12/21, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Upper River Great Ouse in Northamptonshire, Oxfordshire and Buckinghamshire

floodArea.county: Buckinghamshire, Milton Keynes, Oxfordshire, West Northamptonshire

items.message:
River levels are rising at the Brackley river gauge as a result of overnight rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is expected today, 25/12/21.  We expect flooding to affect River Great Ouse from Brackley to Haversham, including Padbury Brook   
Further rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours.  We expect river levels to remain high. 
We are closely monitoring the situation. 
Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  
This message will be updated this evening, 25/12/21, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Alne at Chapel Lane and Church Lane in Aston Cantlow and Great Alne
items.message:
River levels have risen at the Little Alne river gauge as a result of rainfall overnight and in the early hours of today, Saturday 25/12/2021. Consequently, flooding of property, roads and low lying land is possible today, 25/12/2021.     
We expect river levels to rise until later this afternoon, with further rainfall expected this morning, 25/12/2021.
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are actively checking river levels and the weather forecast. Please activate any property flood protection products you may have, such as flood barriers and air brick covers, and avoid contact with flood water.
This message will be updated in 8 hours, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Arrow and River Alne at Alcester and Oversley Mill
items.message:
River levels have risen at the Little Alne river gauge as a result of rainfall overnight and in the early hours of today, Saturday 25/12/2021. Consequently, flooding of property, roads and farmland is possible today, 25/12/2021.  Flooding is likely to affect properties on The Mill Industrial Park and around Arden Road, Springfields Road, School Road, Moorfield Road, Fairwater Crescent to St Mary's Road, Oversley Green, Mill Lane, Arrow Court & Arrow Mill.   
Further rainfall is forecast today, 25/12/2021.  
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are actively checking river levels and the weather forecast. Please activate any property flood protection products you may have, such as flood barriers and air brick covers, and avoid contact with flood water.
This message will be updated in 8 hours, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Middle River Roding
items.message:
Due to wet weather yesterday and overnight river levels have risen and have reacted today, Saturday 25 December. 
The main area of concern is currently Abridge where river levels have risen the most. There is likely to be flooding to low lying land and roads close to the river. Flooding from surface water, where water gathers and flows off road surfaces, could also occur. 
You should avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.
There is further rain expected today and overnight, we expect the river to remain high over the weekend. No flooding to properties is currently expected.
We are constantly monitoring river levels and have staff on standby to attend to any blockages in the river.
This message will be updated this evening or earlier if the situation changes.

items.description: Upper River Colne and Radlett Brook
items.message:
Due to wet weather yesterday and overnight river levels have risen and have reacted to overnight showers today, Saturday 25 December. 
The main area of concern is currently Colney Heath where river levels have risen the most. There is likely to be flooding to low lying land and roads close to the river. Flooding from surface water, where water gathers and flows off road surfaces, could also occur. 
You should avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.
There is further rain expected today and overnight, we expect the river to remain high over the weekend. No flooding to properties is currently expected.
We are constantly monitoring river levels and have staff on standby to attend to any blockages in the river.
This message will be updated this evening or earlier if the situation changes

items.message:

Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is expected today, 25/12/2021. Flooding is affecting low-lying land and roads adjacent to the River Blythe between Cheswick Green and Blyth End.   
Further rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours.  
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are actively checking river levels and the weather forecast.  
Please avoid using low lying footpaths and bridges near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  
This message will be updated this afternoon, 25/12/2021, or as the situation changes.

Further rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours.  
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are actively checking river levels and the weather forecast.  
Please avoid using low lying footpaths and bridges near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.

items.description: Barbourne Brook
items.message:
River levels have risen at the Perdiswell river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is expected from 04:00 today, 25/12/21.  We expect flooding to affect low lying land and roads adjacent the Barbourne Brook from the M5 to Barbourne including Perdiswell and Blackpole Industrial Estate.   
Further rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours.  We expect river levels to remain high over the next few days. 
We are closely monitoring the situation.  Our incident response staff are checking defences and clearing weed screens.  
Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  
This message will be updated  by 17:00 today, 25/12/21, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Salwarpe
items.message:
River levels have risen at the Harford Hill river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is expected from 04:00 today, 25/12/21.  We expect flooding to affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the river from Catshill to Hawford. Other areas that may be affected include Stoke Heath, Elmley Lovett, Droitwich Spa and Ombersley.   
Further rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours.  We expect river levels to remain high over the next few days.
We are closely monitoring the situation.  Our incident response staff are checking defences and clearing weed screens.  
Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  
This message will be updated  by 17:00 on 25/12/21, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Beult from Pluckley and Bethersden to Hampstead Lock at Yalding
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex
items.message:
River levels on the Upper River Beult have risen as a result of rainfall on Christmas Eve and Christmas morning.  Flooding of roads and low lying land is expected from 8:00 am today, 25/12/21, in the Bethersden, Smarden and Headcorn areas. The peak levels in these locations will be seen between 8:00 am and 3:00pm today. The Hunton and Yalding areas may not be affected at this stage. The internal flooding of property is not expected.
We are closely monitoring the situation.  Our incident response staff have been out in advance to check for blockages.  
  
Further rainfall is expected overnight into Boxing Day and so this Flood Alert will probably be in force until at least Monday 27/12/21. This message will be updated by 5pm on 25/12/21, or as the situation changes.

items.description: The Mardyke to the River Thames at Purfleet
items.message: This message has been issued because some minor flooding to low lying land, roads and riverside areas is likely from now into tomorrow, Sunday 26th December 2021. River levels are expected to continue to rise. Areas most at risk are low lying roads and riverside areas along the River Mardyke between North Stifford and Purfleet. The forecast is for further rain this afternoon and overnight to which river levels are likely to react. Take care on riverside footpaths, and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. We are monitoring the situation and will update as necessary.  We will update this message by 10am Sunday 26th December 2021.

items.description: The Rivers Wid and Can
items.message: This message has been issued because some minor flooding to low lying land, roads and riverside areas is likely from now into tomorrow Sunday 26th December 2021. River levels are expected to continue to rise.  Areas most at risk are low lying roads and riverside areas, including Lordship Lane and Cow Watering Lane around Writtle College.  The forecast is for further rain this afternoon and overnight to which river levels are likely to react. Take care on riverside footpaths, and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. We are monitoring the situation and will update as necessary.  We will update this message by 10am Sunday 26th December 2021.

items.description: River Ray and its tributaries from Shipton Lee to and including Islip

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Ray, Wootten Brook, Doddershall Brook, Tetchwick Brook, Lugershall Brook, Murswell Hill Brook, Cutters Brook, Piddington Brook, Blackthorn Brook, Panshill Brook, Studley Wood Brook, Beckley Brook, Oddington Brook, Gallos Brook, Chipping Farm Stream

items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected.
River levels have risen on the River Ray following heavy rainfall yesterday. Therefore, flooding of low-lying land, footpaths and roads is expected today 25/12/21, especially in the Grendon Underwood area. 
Further scattered showers are possible through this morning and early afternoon, before a heavier band of rain passes over the area from later this afternoon. We expect river levels to remain high in response to further rainfall today.
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are closely monitoring river levels in other locations on the River Ray. 
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and avoid contact with flood water. 
This message will be updated this evening, 25/12/21, or as the situation changes.

items.description: North Sea coast from Whitby to Filey

floodArea.county: East Riding of Yorkshire, North Yorkshire

items.message: The flood alert for the North Sea coast from Whitby to Filey has been issued. Overtopping waves and spray are expected as a result of strong onshore winds for the North Sea coast between Whitby and Filey. Overtopping waves are expected on the evening of Saturday, 25/12/2021, between 21:30 hours and 01:30am on Sunday, 26/12/2021. The particular areas at risk are exposed areas of the coast around Scarborough, particularly around Sandside and Foreshore Road. Please be careful along beaches, coastal and estuary footpaths and roads in the area, as large waves and sea spray can be dangerous with debris. We will continue to monitor the forecast and levels closely. This message will be updated on Saturday evening, 25/12/2021, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Evenlode from Moreton in Marsh to Cassington and also the River Glyme at Wootton and Woodstock
items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected.
River levels have risen on the River Evenlode following heavy rainfall yesterday. Therefore, flooding of low-lying land, footpaths and roads is expected imminently today 25/12/21, especially in the Evenlode area. 
Further scattered showers are possible through this morning and early afternoon, before a heavier band of rain passes over the area from later this afternoon. We expect river levels to remain high in response to further rainfall today.
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are in the area clearing weed/trash screens. 
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. 
This message will be updated this evening, 25/12/21, or as the situation changes.

items.description: North Sea coast at Bridlington - Harbour Road and Floral Pavilion
items.message: The flood warning for the North Sea coast at Bridlington - Harbour Road and Floral Pavilion has been issued. Overtopping waves are expected on Saturday evening, 25/12/2021, between 20:30 hours and 21:30 hours. Please be careful along beaches, coastal and estuary footpaths and roads in the area, as large waves and sea spray can be dangerous with debris. We will continue to monitor the forecast and levels closely. This message will be updated on Saturday evening, 25/12/2021, or as the situation changes.
